entry.div:
Sheared
ewes
If the
shearer
sometimes wounds them, he puts
the very
dung of the
ewe
on top. When they are fat, they are easier to shear & do not get wounded so easily.
If the
shearer
wants to
viscorter
them, that is to say castrate, when they are one or two
years
old, he must not have been with his wife for this would make the
sheep
die.
